original_theorem: (a) Union of open sets is open. (b) Intersection of closed sets is closed.
original_proof: (a) Let G be a collection of open sets, S = âˆªG. If xâ‚€ âˆˆ S, then xâ‚€ âˆˆ some open Gâ‚€, so âˆƒ Îµ-nbhd in Gâ‚€ âŠ† S â‡’ S open. (b) If F is a collection of closed sets, T = âˆ©F â‡’ Tá¶œ = âˆªFá¶œ. Each Fá¶œ open â‡’ Tá¶œ open â‡’ T closed.
LLM_output:
```lean4
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0

open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter Set

variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]

/-! ### (a) Union of open sets is open. -/

/-- The union of any collection of open sets is open. -/
theorem union_of_open_is_open (ğ’¢ : Set (Set X)) (h_all_open : âˆ€ G âˆˆ ğ’¢, IsOpen G) :
    IsOpen (â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢) := by
  -- The definition of an open set `S` is that for any point `x âˆˆ S`, `S` is a neighborhood of `x`.
  rw [isOpen_iff_mem_nhds]
  -- Let `x` be an arbitrary point in the union S = â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢. ("If xâ‚€ âˆˆ S, then...")
  intro x hx_in_S
  -- `x âˆˆ â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢` means `x` belongs to at least one set `Gâ‚€` in the collection `ğ’¢`.
  -- ("...xâ‚€ âˆˆ some open Gâ‚€...")
  rw [mem_sUnion] at hx_in_S
  obtain âŸ¨Gâ‚€, hGâ‚€_in_collection, hx_in_Gâ‚€âŸ© := hx_in_S
  -- By hypothesis, this `Gâ‚€` is an an open set.
  have hGâ‚€_is_open : IsOpen Gâ‚€ := h_all_open Gâ‚€ hGâ‚€_in_collection
  -- Since `Gâ‚€` is open and contains `x`, it is a neighborhood of `x`.
  -- ("...so âˆƒ Îµ-nbhd in Gâ‚€...")
  have hGâ‚€_is_neighborhood : Gâ‚€ âˆˆ ğ“ x := IsOpen.mem_nhds hGâ‚€_is_open hx_in_Gâ‚€
  -- The union `â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢` is a superset of `Gâ‚€`, because `Gâ‚€` is one of the sets in the union.
  -- ("...Gâ‚€ âŠ† S...")
  have h_subset : Gâ‚€ âŠ† â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢ := subset_sUnion_of_mem hGâ‚€_in_collection
  -- A superset of a neighborhood is also a neighborhood.
  -- This completes the argument that `S` is a neighborhood of `x`.
  -- ("...â‡’ S open.")
  exact mem_of_superset hGâ‚€_is_neighborhood h_subset

/-! ### (b) Intersection of closed sets is closed. -/

/-- The intersection of any collection of closed sets is closed. -/
theorem intersection_of_closed_is_closed (â„± : Set (Set X)) (h_all_closed : âˆ€ F âˆˆ â„±, IsClosed F) :
    IsClosed (â‹‚â‚€ â„±) := by
  -- A set T is closed iff its complement Tá¶œ is open. We will prove Tá¶œ is open.
  -- This reduces the goal to `IsOpen (â‹‚â‚€ â„±)á¶œ`. ("...â‡’ T closed")
  rw [isClosed_compl_iff]
  -- By de Morgan's Law, the complement of an intersection is the union of complements. ("Tá¶œ = âˆªFá¶œ")
  -- This changes the goal to proving `IsOpen (â‹ƒâ‚€ (compl '' â„±))`.
  rw [compl_sInter]
  -- This union is over the collection of complements `{Fá¶œ | F âˆˆ â„±}`.
  -- The union of a collection of open sets is open, by our previous theorem. ("...â‡’ Tá¶œ open")
  -- The goal now matches the statement of `union_of_open_is_open`.
  apply union_of_open_is_open
  -- The new goal is to show that every set in the collection of complements is open.
  -- Let `G` be such a set. It must be of the form `Fá¶œ` for some `F âˆˆ â„±`. We need to show this `G` is open.
  intro G hG_in_complements
  rw [mem_image] at hG_in_complements
  obtain âŸ¨F, hF_in_collection, rflâŸ© := hG_in_complements
  -- The hypothesis `h_all_closed` says `F` is closed. `IsClosed F` is defined as `IsOpen Fá¶œ`.
  -- This is exactly what we need to prove.
  exact h_all_closed F hF_in_collection
```

```lean4
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0

open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter Set

variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]

/-! ### (a) Union of open sets is open. -/

/-- The union of any collection of open sets is open. -/
theorem union_of_open_is_open (ğ’¢ : Set (Set X)) (h_all_open : âˆ€ G âˆˆ ğ’¢, IsOpen G) :
    IsOpen (â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢) := by
  -- The definition of an open set `S` is that for any point `x âˆˆ S`, `S` is a neighborhood of `x`.
  rw [isOpen_iff_mem_nhds]
  -- Let `x` be an arbitrary point in the union S = â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢. ("If xâ‚€ âˆˆ S, then...")
  intro x hx_in_S
  -- `x âˆˆ â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢` means `x` belongs to at least one set `Gâ‚€` in the collection `ğ’¢`.
  -- ("...xâ‚€ âˆˆ some open Gâ‚€...")
  rw [mem_sUnion] at hx_in_S
  obtain âŸ¨Gâ‚€, hGâ‚€_in_collection, hx_in_Gâ‚€âŸ© := hx_in_S
```
```lean4
  -- By hypothesis, this `Gâ‚€` is an an open set.
  have hGâ‚€_is_open : IsOpen Gâ‚€ := h_all_open Gâ‚€ hGâ‚€_in_collection
  -- Since `Gâ‚€` is open and contains `x`, it is a neighborhood of `x`.
  -- ("...so âˆƒ Îµ-nbhd in Gâ‚€...")
  have hGâ‚€_is_neighborhood : Gâ‚€ âˆˆ ğ“ x := IsOpen.mem_nhds hGâ‚€_is_open hx_in_Gâ‚€
  -- The union `â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢` is a superset of `Gâ‚€`, because `Gâ‚€` is one of the sets in the union.
  -- ("...Gâ‚€ âŠ† S...")
  have h_subset : Gâ‚€ âŠ† â‹ƒâ‚€ ğ’¢ := subset_sUnion_of_mem hGâ‚€_in_collection
  -- A superset of a neighborhood is also a neighborhood.
  -- This completes the argument that `S` is a neighborhood of `x`.
  -- ("...â‡’ S open.")
  exact mem_of_superset hGâ‚€_is_neighborhood h_subset

/-! ### (b) Intersection of closed sets is closed. -/

/-- The intersection of any collection of closed sets is closed. -/
theorem intersection_of_closed_is_closed (â„± : Set (Set X)) (h_all_closed : âˆ€ F âˆˆ â„±, IsClosed F) :
    IsClosed (â‹‚â‚€ â„±) := by
  -- A set T is closed iff its complement Tá¶œ is open. We will prove Tá¶œ is open.
  -- This reduces the goal to `IsOpen (â‹‚â‚€ â„±)á¶œ`. ("...â‡’ T closed")
  rw [isClosed_def]
  -- By de Morgan's Law, the complement of an intersection is the union of complements. ("Tá¶œ = âˆªFá¶œ")
  -- This changes the goal to proving `IsOpen (â‹ƒ F âˆˆ â„±, Fá¶œ)`.
  rw [compl_sInter]
  -- This union is over the collection of complements `{Fá¶œ | F âˆˆ â„±}`.
  -- Each of these complements is open. ("Each Fá¶œ open...")
  -- The union of a collection of open sets is open, by our previous theorem. ("...â‡’ Tá¶œ open")
  -- To apply the theorem `union_of_open_is_open`, we rewrite the union to match its `â‹ƒâ‚€` form.
  rw [â† sUnion_image]
  apply union_of_open_is_open
  -- The new goal is to show that every set in the collection of complements is open.
  -- Let `G` be such a set. It must be of the form `Fá¶œ` for some `F âˆˆ â„±`. We need to show this `G` is open.
  intro G hG_in_complements
  rw [mem_image] at hG_in_complements
  obtain âŸ¨F, hF_in_collection, rflâŸ© := hG_in_complements
  -- The hypothesis `h_all_closed` says `F` is closed. `IsClosed F` is defined as `IsOpen Fá¶œ`.
  -- This is exactly what we need to prove.
  exact h_all_closed F hF_in_collection
```

/-! ### (b) Intersection of closed sets is closed. -/

/-- The intersection of any collection of closed sets is closed. -/
theorem intersection_of_closed_is_closed (â„± : Set (Set X)) (h_all_closed : âˆ€ F âˆˆ â„±, IsClosed F) :
    IsClosed (â‹‚â‚€ â„±) := by

  -- This reduces the goal to `IsOpen (â‹‚â‚€ â„±)á¶œ`. ("...â‡’ T closed")

  rw [compl_sInter]

  -- The union of a collection of open sets is open, by our previous theorem. ("...â‡’ Tá¶œ open")
